text:

name: nytimes
text:
RT @alanfeuer: As protesters start a 6th night
Mayor de Blasio: “The complexities our officers deal with are unimaginable.”
Bronx Councilman: “The city was largely reactive, almost blindsided." 
City detective: “It seems like we have lost control...There’s no direction.”
https://t.co/luvMr607DX

name: nytimes
text:

text: "I'm here for my baby, and I’m here for George, because I want justice for him." Roxie Washington, George Floyd's girlfriend, talks about their 6-year-old daughter, Gianna, growing up without her father. https://t.co/B9PZ98kzQU https://t.co/Ucz59Thkpr

text:

name: nytimes
text:

name: nytimes
text: The Great Filter is a civilization-scale event or circumstance that would prevent a species from colonizing space or ever meeting other species — perhaps of even continuing to exist. It could be nuclear war or global warming, or even a vicious pandemic. https://t.co/AQZEohjCfU

name: nytimes
text: To stop the spread of the coronavirus, nightclubs are still shuttered as Europe emerges from a lockdown. But one German club has found another way to host a party. Honk if you’re having a good time. https://t.co/kzq0OWzg5v

name: nytimes
text: Armed with DNA test results, Kara Bos is asking a South Korean court to rule that an 85-year-old man in Seoul is her father. Her paternity lawsuit could set a precedent for overseas adoptees. https://t.co/EJZjLt8muG

text:

name: nytimes
text: Before President Trump could stride across Lafayette Square in Washington for a photo op at St. John’s Church, protesters had to be cleared out.
